image.altText: A Tasmania Devils mascot stands with kids in Tasmania Devil's merch at a rally

props.synopsis: Supporters of Tasmania's proposed AFL stadium have gathered on Hobart's parliament lawns on Sunday to show their backing of the controversial build.

title.children: 'Now or never': Pro-stadium rally gathers ahead of crucial parliament vote

image.altText: Macquarie Point stadium

props.synopsis: Since its inception, the stadium project has divided the Hobart community in a tug of war between development and preservation of its historic waterfront. In just days, the door will shut forever on one side of the debate.

title.children: Hobart's future will be decided in just days as the city holds its breath

image.altText: A teen boy with thin moustache.

props.synopsis: Local King Island teen Lusian West, 16, has not been seen since Friday, with Tasmania police and rescue crews to conduct aerial searches of the island's north.

title.children: King Island teen missing since Friday, police say

image.altText: A young girl walks across granite rocks covered in orange algae by the beach.

props.synopsis: Twenty years ago, Cape Barren Island was handed back to its traditional owners. Today's children are proof of the life-changing power of that act.

title.children: From capping rent to burying the dead, Cape Barren Island governs itself

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese with his wife, Jodie Haydon.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Jodie Haydon will head off on a five-day honeymoon on Monday after an intimate wedding at The Lodge among only their closest family and friends.

title.children: Albanese and Haydon to head off on honeymoon after surprise wedding

image.altText: Jess Wilson wearing a white top and blue blazer standing in front of green hedges.

props.synopsis: New opposition leader Jess Wilson will retain shadow treasurer responsibilities under a reshuffle, while also keeping multiple former opposition leaders in the fold.

title.children: New leader Jess Wilson to remain Vic shadow treasurer under reshuffle

image.altText: Prisoners asleep on the ground.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's prison watchdog has called on the government to urgently remove all inmates from police cells following an investigation which revealed prisoners sleeping between toilets and claims guards watched women showering.

title.children: Prisoners claim guards 'watched women shower' in NT watch houses

image.altText: NOLb_CFMEUVid_3011

props.synopsis: A walkout was staged by members of the party's Right faction when the motion, which called for the Commonwealth to end the administration of the union, was moved.

title.children: Right faction stages walkout at Labor conference over CFMEU motion

image.altText: A man wearing a blue cap and navy polo shirt smiles.

props.synopsis: The LNP's Wayde Chiesa will be the next representative for the Queensland seat of Hinchinbrook, which had been safely held by Katter's Australian Party since 2017.

title.children: Wayde Chiesa vows to get to work following LNP victory in north Qld

image.altText: A graphic including a newspaper front page, image of von Einem in sunglasses and an inset photo of victim Richard Kelvin

props.synopsis: One of South Australia's most notorious murderers was this week rushed to an infirmary on the brink of death, prompting recollections of the time when young males disappeared across Adelaide in a set of gruesome crimes dubbed "The Family" murders. Warning: This story contains details some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Chapter closes on 'The Family' murders that stole Adelaide's innocence

image.altText: Pope Leo walks out of a black car, wearing full white robes.

props.synopsis: Leo smiled during the 20-minute visit and joked with one of his guides, but did not appear to pray.

title.children: Pope Leo visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque during his four-day visit to Türkiye

image.altText: A blonde girl looking in the mirror as she films a video on her phone.

props.synopsis: Sex workers say viral social media content, which often promotes a life of luxury, needs to be more transparent to avoid duping young followers.

title.children: Young women say social media didn't prepare them for realities of sex work

image.altText: Sussan Ley, Dan Tehan, Jonathon Duniam and Anne Ruston press conference

props.synopsis: Sussan Ley says migration tensions in Australia are not the fault of migrants, but a stronger "Australian values" test for those seeking to move here could form part of the Coalition's coming migration policy.

title.children: Coalition floats stronger 'values' test for migrants

image.altText: Debris and rubbish piled into the street

props.synopsis: Thailand’s Health Ministry estimates that more than 160 people were killed in the disaster across nine provinces, but at least 110 of those died in Songkhla, where Hat Yai is the capital.

title.children: Growing backlash as flooded Thai residents ask 'Where's the government?'

image.altText: William Barratt 1880 first mormon

props.synopsis: It's been 185 years this month since Australia's first Mormon arrived in Adelaide. He immediately regretted the move.

title.children: Australia's first Mormon arrived in Adelaide 185 years ago and immediately regretted it

image.altText: drawing of a horse and rider doing dressage

props.synopsis: As questions around horse welfare grow, can equestrian sport's Olympic dream survive?

title.children: 'Horse's foot falls off': Questions about injured horse owned by Olympian

image.altText: A woman wearing a swimsuit in the ocean with a CGM scanner visible on her stomach.

props.synopsis: We spoke to six people with three different types of diabetes to find out what they wish more of the public knew. Here's what they had to say.

title.children: The things people with diabetes want you to be aware of

image.altText: Em Rusciano in yellow and black houndstooth jacket over yellow top, with ornate jewelled earrings

props.synopsis: As a writer, singer, comedian, podcaster, author and single mum, Em Rusciano has become accustomed to navigating a chaotic life. The self-described "maximalist power queen" shares how she unwinds and how her approach to life has changed since going through perimenopause and being diagnosed with ADHD and autism.

title.children: How Em Rusciano's approach to life has changed since her ADHD and autism diagnoses

image.altText: A surfer tearing up the glassy blue face of a wave on a clear day.

props.synopsis: Surfers wanting to catch a wave at Fiji's world class reef breaks could soon have to pay for the privilege after the repeal of a beach access law.

title.children: Fiji set to repeal free-surfing decree imposed by military dictatorship

image.altText: aerial shot of sandbar off Gold Coast coastline

props.synopsis: Curious beachgoers are being cautioned to stay off the sandbar and to swim between the flags.

title.children: Gold Coast sand 'island' to disappear by Christmas

image.altText: Anthony Pantazopoulos of the Wanderers talks to a referee during a round six A-League Men match.

props.synopsis: Sydney FC's four-match winning streak comes to a crashing halt, but its 1-0 loss to Western Sydney has sparked debate about what constitutes a handball.

title.children: Sydney FC great fumes over alleged handball in Wanderers' ALM win

image.altText: The sun sets on the horizon and against a pale blue sky you see endless rows of power lines and towers.

props.synopsis: If Australia produced 100 per cent of its energy from renewable sources, it would reduce the impact of global energy shocks on Australia's economy.

title.children: Energy independence? It would reduce the impact of global energy shocks

image.altText: two numbats curled up together, snoozing on a log.

props.synopsis: Lyn Alcock is known as the 'Numbat whisperer', spending hours every day observing and photographing the tiny, endangered marsupials, recording behaviours that have never been seen before.

title.children: 'You never know what they're going to do': Two decades of capturing numbat antics on camera

image.altText: A line of people at an airport.

props.synopsis: The airline is warning further disruptions are possible after the issue sparked widespread delays across Australia on Saturday.

title.children: 'Flow-on delays' possible as Jetstar services resume after Airbus issue

image.altText: One woman wearing a yellow t-shirt and one woman wearing a pink t-shirt smile at the camera.

props.synopsis: As the crypto sector expands its appeal beyond tech insiders, the gamification of cryptocurrencies is appealing to younger users, which experts warn is walking the line between gaming and gambling.

title.children: The crypto crazes walking the line between gaming and gambling

image.altText: Tree trunks and debris covered in brown mud lie in front of a damaged house in an area hit by deadly flash floods.

props.synopsis: Torrential rain causes flash floods and landslides in Indonesia, where the toll rises as authorities mount rescue operations.

title.children: Rescue efforts underway after flash floods kill hundreds in Indonesia

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump wearing a suit and red tie.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says the entire airspace above the South American nation of Venezuela should be considered closed in its entirety.

title.children: Trump says airspace above and surrounding Venezuela to be closed

image.altText: Kate Shierlaw celebrates a goal for the Kangaroos in the AFLW grand final against the Lions.

props.synopsis: Creating history by winning consecutive premierships and completing an unbeaten season is just reward for North Melbourne's boundary-pushing AFLW program.

title.children: Lions 'threw the kitchen sink' but nothing could halt Roos' perfect season

image.altText: Black and white photo of person in hoodie sits on stairs

props.synopsis: Sydney's 2000 postcode is associated with harbour views and flashiness, but Parker's seen a different side.

title.children: At 21, Parker fears he might be aging out of a life-changing system

image.altText: McLaren F1 driver Oscar Piastri puts his hand on his head, wearing a cap, as he smiles after qualifying at the Qatar Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Australian driver Oscar Piastri is doing everything he can to catch McLaren teammate Lando Norris in the world championship race, winning the sprint race and qualifying in pole position for the Qatar Grand Prix.

title.children: Piastri's perfect day sees him edge closer to teammate in F1 championship

image.altText: The front page of a document with the words 'joint submission'

props.synopsis: In a scathing rebuke of their own watchdog, WA lawyers claim the state's Legal Practice Board is causing them psychological harm amid calls for urgent reform.

title.children: ‘Lives are being destroyed’: Lawyers slam regulator in inquiry submission

image.altText: Hundreds of flies gather on a feeding area.

props.synopsis: Researchers on Kangaroo Island have been breeding and releasing millions of sterile Australian sheep blowflies in an attempt to eradicate the pest.

title.children: Sterile flies take to the sky in Kangaroo Island eradication push

image.altText: Close up of man in suit with curly grey hair

props.synopsis: Stoppard was often hailed as the greatest British playwright of his generation, with multiple awards for his work on stage and screen.

title.children: Playwright and Oscar winner Tom Stoppard dies at 88

image.altText: Eli Katoa in his hospital bed. His eyes are closed and he has a bandage on his head.

props.synopsis: Melbourne Storm star Eli Katoa shares an update after his brain surgery, posting images of himself in hospital and saying he hopes to return to football "soon".

title.children: Eli Katoa pays tribute to 'amazing' partner as he hopes for NRL return
